author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: FBI Director Kash Patel said the Trump administration’s own budget request wouldn’t be sufficient to fund the agency, asking appropriators to reject a more than $500 million proposed cut in favor of an increased budget. It was an admission that caused momentary confusion with Rep. Rosa DeLauro (D-Conn.), who appeared thrown off by Patel’s rejection…
title: Patel asks appropriators to ignore Trump’s proposed cuts to FBI budget

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Six individuals, including a county judge and city council members, were indicted in Frio County, Texas for allegedly engaging in a vote harvesting scheme.
title: Texas AG announces vote fraud charges against six people

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Trump administration invoked the state secrets privilege Wednesday to avoid handing over documents in the legal battle over Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man mistakenly deported to El Salvador, court records show.  Justice Department officials had long previewed they would do so, but a new order issued by U.S. District Judge Paula Xinis indicates the…
title: Trump administration formally invokes state secrets privilege in Abrego Garcia case

author: Cheyanne M. Daniels
description: Three former Memphis, Tenn., police officers were found not guilty Wednesday on state charges related to the in-custody beating death of Tyre Nichols.  Tadarrius Bean, Demetrius Haley and Justin Smith Jr. were all charged with second-degree murder, aggravated assault, aggravated kidnapping, official misconduct and official oppression for their role in the 2023 death of Nichols…
title: 3 ex-officers involved in Tyre Nichols’s death found not guilty in state trail

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: Sens. Marsha Blackburn (R-Tenn.) and Peter Welch (D-Vt.) introduced a bill Wednesday aimed at boosting passengers’ safety and privacy when in the vehicles of ride-sharing service drivers. The measure, titled the Safe and Private Rides Act, would require transportation network companies to alert passengers if their driver is using a video recording device in the…
title: Bipartisan pair of senators introduces bill to boost ride-sharing passengers’ safety

author: The Hill Staff
description: Cameron Hamilton, the acting director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, will testify before a House Appropriations subcommittee Tuesday afternoon on oversight of the agency. The hearing comes as Homeland Security Secretary (DHS) Kristi Noem has vowed to shutter much of the agency, citing President Trump’s wish for states to have more control over emergency…
title: Watch live: Acting FEMA director testifies before House as Trump admin moves to shutter agency

author: The Hill Staff
description: FBI Director Kash Patel will face questioning Tuesday by a House Appropriations Committee panel on oversight and the fiscal 2026 budget for the intelligence agency, just more than 100 days since President Trump returned to the White House. His testimony comes as the FBI has faced scrutiny over layoffs amid the administration’s overhaul of the…
title: Watch live: Patel testifies before House on oversight of FBI

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Authorities arrested 205 suspected child predators in a five-day operation, rescuing 115 children. Suspects have been charged with crimes such as online enticement, child sex trafficking, and the production, distribution and possession of child sexual abuse material.
title: 200+ alleged child predators arrested in FBI operation, officials say

author: Filip Timotija
description: Sen. Tom Cotton (R-Ark.) asked Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard to refrain from sharing intelligence with Germany’s domestic intelligence agency days after the country’s spy arm labeled the far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, as an “extremist” political party. Cotton requested that, until Germany treats the AfD as a “legitimate opposition party” and not…
title: Cotton asks Gabbard not to share intel with Germany that can be used against far-right party

author: Cheyanne M. Daniels
description: Americans are growing less optimistic about race relations across the nation, with only 51 percent saying Black Americans will “eventually” have the same rights as white Americans, according to a new survey.  The Pew Research Center examined Americans’ views on race, policing and Black Lives Matter five years after the murder of George Floyd and found that…
title: Only half of Americans say Black Americans will ‘eventually’ have equal rights to white Americans: Survey

author: Filip Timotija
description: Four in 10 Americans said the U.S. is in a recession, while another third of respondents argued it is not, according to a survey published Tuesday.  The latest The Economist/YouGov poll found that 40 percent of U.S. adults said the country is in a recession, while 35 percent disagreed. A quarter of respondents were not…
title: 4 in 10 say US in recession: Survey

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Disney has announced the seventh Walt Disney theme park resort to be located in Abu Dhabi, developed and built by Miral, with Disney's Imagineering team leading the creative design and operational oversight.
title: Disney to build park in Abu Dhabi

author: Arturo McFields, Opinion Contributor
description: The U.S. is ratifying its commitment to review and reverse China's influence in the Americas and beyond, with key achievements such as the dismantling of a Chinese hacking system in Guatemala, strengthening of military cooperation in Argentina, interruption of a space project in Chile, failure of an anti-Trump BRICS Summit in Brazil, and strengthening of military alliances on the Caribbean.
title: The US is crushing China in real time in the Americas

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Trump administration is exploring deporting migrants to Libya, multiple outlets reported Wednesday, the latest move as the White House eyes a series of foreign locations for removals. According to Reuters, which first reported the news, U.S. military planes could fly migrants to the North African country as soon as Wednesday. The nationality of those who…
title: Trump administration mulls deportation flights to Libya

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump endorsed Rep. Mike Lawler (R-N.Y.) and praised him for his effectiveness in Congress, which could potentially affect Lawler's decision to run for New York governor.
title: Trump endorses Lawler’s reelection bid amid New York governor speculation

author: Heather Reams and Rep. Randy Weber (R-Texas), opinion contributors
description: The Trump administration is promoting geothermal energy as part of its National Energy Emergency Executive Order, which could unlock up to 5,000 gigawatts of energy and create economic boosts in communities across the country and strengthen national security.
title: Trump can put geothermal in a position to power America’s future

author: Filip Timotija
description: The deadline to upgrade to a Real ID-complaint card, before Transportation Security Administration (TSA) agents begin requiring them at the airport, has now passed. The Real ID Act, passed by Congress in 2005, took effect on Wednesday morning as uncertainty mounts about whether Americans can still travel domestically, even without a compliant ID.  Department of…
title: REAL ID deadline passes amid uncertainty

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Biden criticized President Trump’s approach to ending the war in Ukraine as “modern-day appeasement,” saying no concession to Russia will dissuade its leader from trying to retake its neighbor. In a sit-down interview with the BBC on Monday, Biden was asked about Trump saying that Ukraine will have to cede some territory to Russia…
title: Biden: Trump’s ‘modern-day appeasement’ won’t satisfy Russia

author: Benjamin P. Edwards and Nancy B. Rapoport, opinion contributors
description: Recent actions from Edward R. Martin, Jr., the current interim United States Attorney for the District of Columbia, raise questions about when a federal prosecutor goes too far.
title: Ed Martin’s conduct in office raises serious questions about his ethics

author: The Hill Staff
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is testifying Wednesday before the House Financial Services Committee on the state of international financial systems. Bessent has criticized operations at the World Bank and International Monetary Fund in recent weeks, claiming the institutions have “fallen short” of their mission, and called for reform. The scrutiny comes as the Trump administration…
title: Watch live: Bessent testifies before House on international financial systems

author: W. Joseph Campbell, opinion contributor
description: Rather than berate them as “negative criminals” and call for their investigation, the president should pursue a more rational, record-based case against them — if, that is, he’s able to tone down the hyperbole and focus on the facts.
title: How Trump can turn the tables on the pollsters
